result.execSummary:
The defendant Travon J. Reese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Valeria B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26213814 in court 1x on 9/6/15.
Request for payment of$17 witness fees for witness Devalla B.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26213813 in court 1x on 9/6/15.

Defendant Travon J. Reese in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Travon J. Reese in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
This case was scheduled for trial today.  The parties have reached an agreement.
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the penalty enhancer as to both counts dismissed.
As to counts 1 and 2 as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the pleas.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by:  Devalla B. and her mother.
As to count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 8 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, concurrent with count 2 but consecutive to the sentence he is now serving with credit for -0- days time served.
As to count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 2 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, concurrent with count 2 but consecutive to the sentence he is now serving with credit for -0- days time served.
.
COURT ORDERS:
- Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay DNA surcharge-
 Defendant found indigent and waived costs and surcharges, except for the DNA surcharge and the DV surcharge.  These surcharges are to be paid within 1 year of today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Travon J. Reese not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The defendant is not in court, he is currently in Jackson Correctional Institution.  Defense counsel waives his appearance.
Jury trial remains calendared for 09/16/2015 at 08:30 a.m.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Travon J. Reese not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced, appearance waived. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial in branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ORDER TO PRODUCE, WEDNESDAY, JULY 01, 2015 AT 8:30 A.M. IN BR 23, CH RM 502. kl

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Travon J. Reese not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced from the Wisconsin State Prison. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of the Pretrial Conference for a Scheduling date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEVALLA B.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Travon J. Reese in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Travon J. Reese in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
